agave
Interface LifecycleHooks

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultLifecycleHooks
public interface LifecycleHooks

Hooks into Agave's lifecycle. The default implementation of this is DefaultLifecycleHooks, but you can override it by specifying an initialization param to the AgaveFilter. An example of this is: 

<web-app>
 ...
 <filter>
   <filter-name>AgaveFilter</filter-name>
   <filter-class>agave.AgaveFilter</filter-class>
   <init-param>
     <param-name>lifecycleHooks</param-name>
     <param-value>com.domain.package.LifecycleHooks</param-value>
   </init-param>
 </filter>
 ...
 </web-app>
Note that only a single value is supported, so there is no way to have multiple InstanceCreators, unless the value named by the parameter fronts multiple others. This is intentional, and was designed to be this way so that the conceptual overhead of using Agave is shallow.

Author:
Damian Carrillo
